sect1.title: Object Constants
sect1.para: It is possible to define constant values on a per-class basis remaining the same and unchangeable. Constant's differ from normal variables in that you dont use the $ symbol to declare or use them. Like members, constant values can not be accessed with a variable that is an instance of the object.

example.title: Defining and using a constant
example.programlisting:
<?php
class MyClass {
  const constant = 'constant value';

  function showConstant() {
    echo  self::constant . "\n";
  }
}

echo MyClass::constant . "\n";

$class = new MyClass();
$class->showConstant();
/* echo $class::constant;  is not allowed */
?>
